phrase.transcription: Amurin gag puserek, Nick, kafo gag pusereki kusu go wit.
phrase.translation: I want to tell you, Nick, I'll tell you about the rat and the octopus.

phrase.transcription: Naliati iskei, elau imat.
phrase.translation: One day, it was low tide.

phrase.transcription: Elau imat, itrau mat pe mat pe mat me.
phrase.translation: It was low tide, a really low tide.

phrase.transcription: Ipiatlak nskau ienkot naur iskei
phrase.translation: There was a reef around an island.

phrase.transcription: Naur ses iskei ito elau me elau imat
phrase.translation: This island was in the sea, but the tide was out.

phrase.transcription: Malen elau imat kerkrai,
phrase.translation: When the tide was very low,

phrase.transcription: mat top, go nskau igar userek
phrase.translation: very low, the reef was dry right around the island

phrase.transcription: pan tkal naur ses.
phrase.translation: right up to the small island.

phrase.transcription: Me kusu, kusu iskei, ito Efat
phrase.translation: But the rat, this rat, it was from Efate.

phrase.transcription: Ileka na elau imat top. Isemsem imur nag isiw, isiwer ur nskau
phrase.translation: It saw that the tide was out. It was happy, he wanted to walk along the reef.

phrase.transcription: Ipi nlaken kusu isiwer, ipan pato siwer ur nskau panpanpan
phrase.translation: That's why the rat walked along the reef, until

phrase.transcription: Ipak naur ses
phrase.translation: It got to the small island.

phrase.transcription: Ipak naur ses. Isiwer [epe] panpan inrogo kin nlag.
phrase.translation: It walked to the small island. It walked and it felt the wind.

phrase.transcription: Inrogo kin nlag na nanre naur ses ne, go
phrase.translation: It felt the wind along the side of the island, and

phrase.transcription: ipen marmar
phrase.translation: it rested there.

phrase.transcription: Ipato marmar panpan panpan panpan panpan me elau kipe to mu
phrase.translation: It stayed, rested for a long time, but the tide started to come in.

phrase.transcription: Elau kipe to mu, me selwan kin
phrase.translation: The tide came in, but as

phrase.transcription: ipen sat nlag panpanpan imroki nen keler.
phrase.translation: he felt the wind, he thought he would return.

phrase.transcription: Me imai me elau kipe mu top
phrase.translation: He came, but the the tide was too high.

phrase.transcription: Elau imu top go, ipregi ipe kano nrokot.
phrase.translation: The tide was too high so that he couldn't cross.

phrase.transcription: Nlaken kin elau kipe mu top
phrase.translation: Because the tide was too high.

phrase.transcription: Nao kin kipe to mai pa
phrase.translation: A wave came in

phrase.transcription: go kipe tu fit lefek
phrase.translation: and the rat ran around.

phrase.transcription: Itu fit lefek imurin na
phrase.translation: It ran around, it wanted

phrase.transcription: inrokot me kipe kano.
phrase.translation: to cross, but it couldn't.

phrase.transcription: Go, malfane, wit wit imai.
phrase.translation: And now the octopus came.

phrase.transcription: Wit imai me ileka kin ito fit lefek.
phrase.translation: The octopus came and saw that he was running around.

phrase.transcription: Go wit kipaoski na,
phrase.translation: And the octopus asked him,

phrase.transcription: "Me ag kuku? Kumurin na kufak nanre ko?"
phrase.translation: "But what are you doing? Do you want to go to the other side?"

phrase.transcription: Me ina "Ore, kineu amatur, natowen neu ato nanre.
phrase.translation: And the rat said, "Yes, I sleep, I stay on the other side.

phrase.transcription: Ato Efat."
phrase.translation: I stay on Efate

phrase.transcription: Me amai marmar esan me.
phrase.translation: But I come over here to rest."

phrase.transcription: Ale, kusu ito fit lefek, ito fit lefek, ki naur me
phrase.translation: So the rat kept running around the island, but

phrase.transcription: wit kipe leka.
phrase.translation: the octopus saw the rat.

phrase.transcription: Selwan wit ina imai,
phrase.translation: When the octopus wanted to come,

phrase.transcription: imai pak eut me ipan soksoki ina "Me ag kuku?"
phrase.translation: it came to the sea and it said, "And what are you doing?"

phrase.transcription: Me ina, "Neu natowen neu ato Efat.
phrase.translation: And it said, "My life is on Efate.

phrase.transcription: Me alek elau imat wi.
phrase.translation: But I saw that the tide is really low.

phrase.transcription: Ato siwer ur nskau mai mai, anrogo kin nlag ni naur ses, go
phrase.translation: I walked over the reef and came, I felt the wind from the small island, and

phrase.transcription: kaipe to marmar panpanpan malfane.
phrase.translation: I stayed and rested until now.

phrase.transcription: Namroan neu amroki nen kafei ler me elau kipe mu top.
phrase.translation: I thought I could get back but the tide was too high.

phrase.transcription: Go, kineu kaipe kano nrokot nlaken kin elau kipe mu top."
phrase.translation: And I couldn't cross back because the tide was too high."

phrase.transcription: Go wit ipaoskin ki, ina "Me kumurin na kawelua?"
phrase.translation: And the octopus asked the rat, "Do you want me to help you?"

phrase.transcription: Go kusu ina "Me wel kin kuwelu wou iwi top."
phrase.translation: And the rat said, "If you would help me it would be very good."

phrase.transcription: Ina, "P̃amai totan na [nwak].
phrase.translation: It said, "Come and sit on the [nwak?]."

phrase.transcription: P̃amai totan na [nwak], me kineu kafo fan nrokot."
phrase.translation: Come and sit on the [nwak] and I will go across."

phrase.transcription: Malfane, kusu ipan totan.
phrase.translation: So the rat sat down.

phrase.transcription: Na n- wit, me wit iofa nrokot nen kefan psi na, Efat.
phrase.translation: The octopus carried the rat and put it on Efate.

phrase.transcription: Me malen kefan to namos me nao kipe top.
phrase.translation: But when it was in the ocean the waves were too big.

phrase.transcription: Nlaken nao imai na, islatir epak elag tefla.
phrase.translation: Because the wave came and took them up high.

phrase.transcription: Go np̃au wit kimer tul
phrase.translation: And the octopus's head was swaying.

phrase.transcription: Np̃au wit itul tefla, go kusu ina ito imer murki.
phrase.translation: The octopus's head was swaying, and the rat decided he wanted it.

phrase.transcription: Kusu ito murki np̃au wit.
phrase.translation: The rat wanted the head of the octopus.

phrase.transcription: Go wit ina ito me ina, "Me ag kuto murki nafte?"
phrase.translation: And the octopus said, "What do you want?"

phrase.transcription: Go kusu ina, "E ato mur kin nao isat, kitau pakelag kaimer paketan
phrase.translation: And the rat said, "I wanted the wave to take us up high."

phrase.transcription: Rapanpan na rato na nmal namos.
phrase.translation: They kept on going until they were in the middle of the sea.

phrase.transcription: Me nao kipe kerkerai.
phrase.translation: But the wave was strong.

phrase.transcription: Islatir teflan go np̃au wit kimer tul
phrase.translation: It took them like this and the octopus's head swayed again.

phrase.transcription: Go kusu kimer mrosmanr na
phrase.translation: And the rat again thought about

phrase.transcription: np̃au wit, go kimer mur, go ina "A me kumurin naftekin?"
phrase.translation: the octopus's head, and wanted it, and the octopus said, "What do you want?"

phrase.transcription: Ina "E, itik amur kin ki nao ito slat kito pakelag me imer paketan."
phrase.translation: The rat said, "No, I want the wave to take us, it was up high but it went down again."

phrase.transcription: Me gar rapanpan panpan rapak natik eut.
phrase.translation: And they kept on going until they got to the shore.

phrase.transcription: Kusu ileka na itae sok pak nmal nawen
phrase.translation: The rat saw that it could jump into the middle of the sand.

phrase.transcription: Ikam np̃au wit trau sok.
phrase.translation: It stood on the octopus's head and jumped.

phrase.transcription: Isok pak na nmal nawen pan, na ile [mar] ilek wit pak elau, me inrik wit ki na,
phrase.translation: It jumped to the middle of the sand, and it saw the octopus in the sea and said to the octopus,

phrase.transcription: "Kineu ato murki np̃aum kia."
phrase.translation: "I want your head."

phrase.transcription: Ito murki np̃aun nlaken kin na, nao islat na,
phrase.translation: The rat wanted the octopus's head because the wave had taken,

phrase.transcription: islatki tefla go np̃aun kimer farfar kimer tul.
phrase.translation: it had taken it like this, and the head had continued to move about, to sway.

phrase.transcription: Ina, "Ato murki np̃aum."
phrase.translation: It said, "I still want your head."

phrase.transcription: Me wit kipe maetki
phrase.translation: And the octopus got angry with the rat.

phrase.transcription: Me na, imaetki kusu teflan go ipuetlu nlap̃uen me ifis
phrase.translation: It got angry with the rat, and it took off a tentacle and whipped,

phrase.transcription: ipulkin pak kusu
phrase.translation: it slung it at the rat.

phrase.transcription: ipul kusu ki go, gawankin nlap̃ wit, naen wan kin ipuki napu kusu to.
phrase.translation: It slung the rat with it and that's the octopus's tentacles, nine that he pulled at the rat's tail.

phrase.transcription: Nlap̃ wit ipi, wit ipiatlak nlap̃uen ipi naen.
phrase.translation: The octopus had nine tentacles.

phrase.transcription: Me ina ipuetlu iskei na ipul kusu kin go kusu iof napuen iskei ipi napuen me
phrase.translation: But it wanted to take off one of them to sling it at the rat and the rat put on its tail, it became its tail.

phrase.transcription: Ga ipiatlak na nlap̃uen rupi eit.
phrase.translation: (The octopus) It had eight tentacles.

phrase.transcription: Go natrausuen gar kipe nom esa.
phrase.translation: And their story finishes here.
